summary: Completed comprehensive testing of GrameenGo microfinance platform. Backend APIs are 90.9% functional with sample data loaded. Frontend loads correctly but has authentication integration issues preventing full user flow testing.

critical_bugs.issue: Returns 500 error when creating applications due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue

ui_bugs.issue: Login API call succeeds but frontend doesn't handle response correctly - user remains on login page
Role select dropdown not found with data-testid selector

integration_issues.issue: Frontend authentication context not properly handling JWT tokens from backend login response
All routes including MFI directory appear to require authentication, preventing public access

passed_tests: Backend user login API (returns valid JWT token)
Backend MFI endpoints (10 MFIs loaded successfully)
Backend loan products endpoint (20 products loaded)
Frontend landing page loads with proper branding
Frontend navigation between public pages (landing, login, register)
Sample data initialization (10 Bangladesh MFIs, 20 loan products)

critical_fixes: Fix frontend authentication flow - login API works but frontend doesn't redirect to dashboard
Fix MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue in application creation endpoint
Review AuthContext.js to ensure proper JWT token handling and storage
medium_priority: Add data-testid to role select dropdown in registration form
Consider making MFI directory publicly accessible without authentication
action_item_for_main_agent.notes: Backend is mostly functional (90.9% success rate) with proper CORS configuration. Frontend UI renders correctly but authentication integration needs fixing.
